data: CARD SURG Impella Ventricular Assist Device
Monitor patient and impella console as per nursing guideline
For femoral insertion. Keep limb with pump insertion site straight
For axilla insertion. RN must accompany patient during ambulation to ensure Impella lines secure
The amount of heparin in the Impella purge solution may not be enough to achieve goal anticoagulation of PTT 50 to 70 seconds (low target range)
heparin purge solution titratable infusion (50 unit/mL) in D5W

Systemic heparin low-target for Impella Protocol
CARD SURG Systemic Heparin Infusion For Impella (Module)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when patient on heparin, then order PTT q6h until PTT is therapeutic
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 7 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 2 day
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
Arterial Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Arterial Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 2 day
Arterial Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Arterial Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 2 day
If hematuria present, select Hemoglobin Free Plasma and Lactate Dehydrogenase
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when hematuria present, then order hemoglobin free plasma and lactate dehydrogenase
Urgent, Reason: Post-Impella Ventricular Assist Device Implant, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation

Routine, Schedule as: Inpatient Scheduling Location: SPH Echo, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation, Primary Indication: Heart Failure, Special Instructions: 24 hours post-Impella V
If/when: purge flow rate or pressure generates Impella console alarm and for any impella problems
Notify Abiomed representative or Abiomed 24/7 Customer Care Centre 1-800-422-8666 for Impella problems
Request KCI TheraPulse bed if more than 48 hours of intubation is anticipated
